DOC.brief_summary: The investigators seek to prospectively compare intubation with the Glidescope Cobalt to Direct Laryngoscopy (DL) in infants.
DOC.brief_title: Comparing Use of the Glidescope Cobalt to Direct Laryngoscopy in Infants
DOC.detailed_description: We seek to study the intubation characteristics of a new video laryngoscope, the Glidescope Cobalt in children less than or equal to 1 yr of age. This evaluation would provide insight as to the efficacy of this device in facilitating intubation in infants.
DOC.criteria: 1. Scheduled to undergo elective surgery at CHOP 2. American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Physical Status I or II 3. Anesthetic plan requiring tracheal intubation with a neuromuscular relaxant 4. Parental/guardian permission (informed consent). Subjects will be too young to understand the study procedures and therefore assent will not be sought. 1. At known or anticipated high risk for aspiration pneumonia 2. Known or predicted difficult intubation as assessed by the clinical attending anesthesiologist 3. Emergency surgical procedure 4. Patients with preoperative airway pathology or stridor
